MATHEMATICS FOR MACHINE LEARNING

The document discusses the fundamental mathematical tools needed to understand machine learning, including linear algebra, analytic geometry, and optimization. It bridges the gap between mathematical and machine learning texts by introducing these concepts with minimal prerequisites. The book uses these concepts to derive four central machine learning methods: linear regression, principal component analysis, Gaussian mixture models, and support vector machines.
